cards.name: Weedle
cards.text: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

attacks.name: Triple Stab
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Kakuna
cards.text: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Beedrill
cards.text: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

attacks.name: Swift Sting
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has full HP, this attack does 40 more damage, and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Exeggcute

abilities.name: Propagation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put this Pokémon into your hand.

cards.text: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

cards.name: Exeggutor
cards.text: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

attacks.name: Blockade
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Treecko
cards.text: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Grovyle
cards.text: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

cards.name: Sceptile
cards.text: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Bloom
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

cards.name: Cacnea
cards.text: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive for 30 days without water.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Cacturne
cards.text: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.

attacks.name: Rapid-Fire Needles
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 60 more damage and discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Leafeon
cards.text: With cells similar to those of plants, it performs photosynthesis inside its body and creates pure air.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Flareon
cards.text: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees F.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Heatran-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Boiler
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Dynamite Press
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Litwick
cards.text: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when it absorbs life force from people or Pokémon.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Lampent
cards.text: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Chandelure

abilities.name: Flare Navigate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Reshiram
cards.text: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

attacks.name: Purifying Flame
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fusion Flare
attacks.text: If Zekrom is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Horsea
cards.text: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

attacks.name: Fin Smack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Seadra
cards.text: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional-medicine ingredients.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Vaporeon
cards.text: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can't be seen when it melts away into water.

attacks.name: Refreshing Rain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gold Breaker
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Wooper
cards.text: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Quagsire

abilities.name: Laid-Back
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It has an easygoing nature. It doesn't care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.

attacks.name: Mud Gun
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fighting Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Glaceon

abilities.name: Freeze Zone
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost of each of your Team Plasma Pokémon in play is ColorlessColorless less.

cards.text: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Tympole
cards.text: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Palpitoad
cards.text: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

attacks.name: Suspicious Soundwave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Seismitoad
cards.text: By putting power into its bumps, it creates vibrations and increases the power of its punches.

attacks.name: Seismic Punch
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Splashing Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Vanillite
cards.text: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Vanillish
cards.text: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.

attacks.name: Surefire Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Vanilluxe
cards.text: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.

attacks.name: ChillMAX
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Cryogonal
cards.text: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148° F.

attacks.name: Call Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Cryofreeze
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Kyurem
cards.text: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

attacks.name: Frost Spear
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

cards.name: Electrode

abilities.name: Magnetic Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand.

cards.text: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

cards.name: Jolteon
cards.text: By storing electricity in its body, it can shoot its bristlelike fur like a barrage of missiles.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Electri-Defuse
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, that Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Chinchou
cards.text: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

cards.name: Lanturn
cards.text: Lanturn's light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed "The Deep-Sea Star."

attacks.name: Special Tackle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Extreme Current
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Pachirisu
cards.text: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Electric Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Thundurus-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Raiden Knuckle
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Team Plasma Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderous Noise
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Zekrom
cards.text: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Fusion Bolt
attacks.text: If Reshiram is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Nidoran ♀
cards.text: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from its barbs can be fatal.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Nidorina
cards.text: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino's.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Nidoqueen
cards.text: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Nidoran ♂
cards.text: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

attacks.name: Hit Back
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Nidorino
cards.text: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Grimer
cards.text: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

attacks.name: Lure Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Muk
cards.text: It's so stinky! Muk's body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.

attacks.name: Poison Suction
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sludge Crash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Bench Barrier
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by attacks.

cards.text: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Espeon
cards.text: Its fur is so sensitive, it can feel minute shifts in the air and predict the weather…and its foes' thoughts.

attacks.name: Psy Alert
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Shadow Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Also apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Sableye
cards.text: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

attacks.name: Shadow Cage
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Beldum
cards.text: Its cells are all magnetic, and it communicates with others by using magnetic pulses.

attacks.name: Calculate
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Metang
cards.text: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Metagross

abilities.name: Plasma Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Team Plasma card, reveal it, and put it in your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You may not use an Ability with the same name during your turn.

cards.text: With four linked brains, it's more intelligent than a supercomputer, and it uses calculations to analyze foes.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Deoxys-EX

abilities.name: Power Connect
abilities.text: Your Team Plasma Pokémon's attacks (excluding Deoxys-EX) do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Helix Force
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Yamask
cards.text: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.

attacks.name: Transfer Pain
attacks.text: Move 1 damage counter from any of your Pokémon to any of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Yamask
cards.text: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.

cards.name: Cofagrigus

abilities.name: Six Feet Under
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack) you may Knock Out this Pokémon. If you do, put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.text: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

attacks.name: Slap of Misfortune
attacks.text: Whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her next turn, treat it as tails.

cards.name: Cofagrigus
cards.text: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

attacks.name: Elongating Arms
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Crazy Slap
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Nidoking
cards.text: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

attacks.name: Lovestrike
attacks.text: Does 40 more damage for each Nidoqueen on your Bench.

cards.name: Mankey
cards.text: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

cards.name: Primeape
cards.text: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 80 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Onix
cards.text: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Makuhita
cards.text: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.

attacks.name: Continuous Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Hariyama
cards.text: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pivot Throw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is increased by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Umbreon

abilities.name: Dark Shade
abilities.text: Each of your Team Plasma Pokémon in play gets +20 HP.

cards.text: When exposed to the moon's aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it's filled with a mysterious power.

cards.name: Sneasel
cards.text: A smart and sneaky Pokémon, it makes its opponents flinch by suddenly showing the claws hidden in its paws.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Weavile
cards.text: They communicate by clawing signs in boulders and work together to surround enemies.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Vilify
attacks.text: Discard as many Pokémon as you like from your hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Pokémon you discarded.

cards.name: Absol
cards.text: It appears from deep in the mountains to warn people about upcoming disasters it has sensed with its horn.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fearsome Shadow
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

cards.name: Sandile
cards.text: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.

attacks.name: Gentle Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Krokorok
cards.text: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.

cards.name: Krookodile
cards.text: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.

attacks.name: Piston Headbutt
attacks.text: Move an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Pawniard
cards.text: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

cards.name: Pawniard
cards.text: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

cards.name: Bisharp
cards.text: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.

attacks.name: Dragon Slayer
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Bisharp
cards.text: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.

attacks.name: Cut Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Deino
cards.text: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Deino
cards.text: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Zweilous
cards.text: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Hydreigon
cards.text: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

attacks.name: Tractorbeam
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Obsidian Fang
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Steelix
cards.text: The iron it ingested with the soil it swallowed transformed its body and made it harder than diamonds.

attacks.name: Metal Defender
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.name: Mawile
cards.text: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Big Ol' Bite
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Dratini
cards.text: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Dragonair
cards.text: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Dragonite
cards.text: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

attacks.name: Deafen
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Healwing
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Kingdra
cards.text: It lives in caves on the seafloor and creates giant whirlpools every time it moves.

attacks.name: Dragon Vortex
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Water Energy cards and Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile. Then, shuffle all of those cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Tri Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Latias-EX

abilities.name: Bright Down
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon with Abilities.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Barrier Break
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Latios-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mach Flight
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Rattata
cards.text: It searches for food all day. It gnaws on hard objects to wear down its fangs, which grow constantly during its lifetime.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Raticate
cards.text: With its long fangs, this surprisingly violent Pokémon can gnaw away even thick concrete with ease.

attacks.name: Transfer Junk
attacks.text: Put a Team Plasma Pokémon, a Team Plasma Trainer card, and a Team Plasma Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

attacks.text: Search your deck for 3 Pokémon of different types that evolve from Eevee. Reveal them and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Hoothoot
cards.text: It marks time precisely. Some countries consider it to be a wise friend, versed in the world's ways.

attacks.name: Dual Draw
attacks.text: Each player draws 2 cards.

cards.name: Noctowl
cards.text: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.

attacks.name: Powerful Vision

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Miltank
cards.text: It is said that kids who drink Miltank's milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.

attacks.name: Max Milk
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. Then, discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Kecleon

abilities.name: Color Change
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, this Pokémon is the same type as the your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.text: It can freely change its body's color. The zigzag pattern on its belly doesn't change, however.

attacks.name: Imittack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. If this Pokémon has the necessary Energy to use that attack, use it as this attack.

cards.name: Starly
cards.text: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.

cards.name: Staravia
cards.text: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Staraptor
cards.text: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.

attacks.name: Strong Breeze
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

cards.name: Tornadus-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Windfall
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Jet Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Float Stone
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Retreat Cost.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Frozen City
cards.text: Whenever any player attaches an Energy from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon (excluding Team Plasma Pokémon) put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Ghetsis
cards.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand and shuffles all Item cards found there into his or her deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of Item cards your opponent shuffled into his or her deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Shadow Triad
cards.text: Put a Team Plasma card from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Superior Energy Retrieval
cards.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Put 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't choose a card you discarded with the effect of this card.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Team Plasma Badge
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Pokémon this card is attached to is a Team Plasma Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Team Plasma Ball
cards.text: Search your deck for a Team Plasma Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Plasma Energy
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.

cards.name: Life Dew
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 1 fewer Prize card.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).,You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Rock Guard
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).,You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

attacks.name: Heat Boiler

attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Thundurus-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Raiden Knuckle
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Team Plasma Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderous Noise
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Deoxys-EX

abilities.text: Your Team Plasma Pokémon's attacks (excluding Deoxys-EX) do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.
